question: 1) What is the Dojo?
answer: A Dojo is an open source JavaScript library. It provides an easy way to design and develop JavaScript/AJAX-based applications and websites. It is just like a JavaScript toolkit that develops cross-platform applications rapidly.

question: 2) What are the most prominent features of Dojo?
answer:
ADVERTISEMENT
Dojo is an open source JavaScript toolkit.
It is easy to learn.
It is used to develop highly interactive web applications.
It offers widgets, utilities, and higher IO abstraction.
It is licensed by BSD or AFL.
Dojo development was first started by Alex Russell and Dylan Schiemann in 2004. The very first Dojo code was written in September 2004. It is released in March 2005.

question: 4) What is the basic directory structure of Dojo?
answer:
The basic directory structure of Dojo is simple and contains the following three points:
/index.html : The application entry point.
/app: The application module.
/app/main.js: The main script for the app module.

question: 5) Explain the Dojo architecture?
answer:
Dojo architecture contains the following:
DojoX - It contains various unstable modules. So, still, it is difficult to include it in dojo or dijit.
Dijit - It is a toolkit of user-interface modules for layout and widgets.
Dojo Core - It includes the core and most non-visual modules.
Dojo Base - It contains the set of functionalities that are available automatically.
Custom code - It includes JavaScript code, HTML markup, and CSS style declarations.
Util - It contains the build tools like optimization, style-checking, documentation, and testing.

question: 6) What are the advantages or benefits of Dojo?
answer:
Dojo is a very high-quality JavaScript toolkit. It has several advantages or benefits that support:
Loosely typed variables
Associative arrays
Objects and classes
W3C DOM support in the Dojo
Regular expression
Associative arrays

question: 7) What is the use of DOJO DOM functions?
answer: DOJO DOM functions can be used to create, delete, update, insert and read the elements on the page. Its focus is to improve the cross-browser incompatibilities and makes common operations simple.

question: 8) Mention some of the disadvantages/drawbacks of Dojo?
answer:
Disadvantages/ limitation of Dojo:
Dojo supports limited browsers.
You can't hide the Dojo codes in the case of commercial application.
Dojo requires many networks.
Documentation is quite narrow.

question: 9) What is Dijit?
answer:
Dijit is a DOJO's user interface library that provides the widget to build web 2.0 GUI's with or without using JavaScript. The Dijit can be used in any of the two ways:
declaratively by using particular attributes inside of regular HTML tags
programmatically through JavaScript

question: 10) Which resources do a Widget consists?
answer:
A widget contains the following two resources:
JavaScript file
HTML snippet

question: 11) What are the features provided by DOJO Widgets?
answer:
A widget contains the following interactive features:
Sortable tables
Dynamic charts
Menus
Tooltips
Tabs
2D vector drawings

question: 12) What is the use of modules in Dojo?
answer: In DOJO, modules are written in Asynchronous Module Definition format that makes code easier to debug. A single reference can access a module. If you want to expose multiple functions in a module, properties are required on a single object that represents the module.

question: 13) What is the use of Asynchronous module definition (AMD)?
answer: The Asynchronous module definition (AMD) is just a specification for JavaScript. It defines an application programming interface (API) that defines code module along their dependencies and loads them asynchronously if required.

question: 14) What are the advantages of Dojo charting?
answer:
These are the main advantages of DOJO charting:
It presents statistical data in a readable manner.
It provides various inbuilt themes and chart types.
It facilitates to represent data in any way.
It is capable of working on almost all the devices.

question: 15) What are the various components of the Dojo framework?
answer:
A list of components that comes along with Dojo framework:
Base
Dijit
Dojox
Util

Difference between Dojo and JQuery:
Table
Dojo JQuery
Dojo is a framework. JQuery is a JavaScript library.
Dojo toolkit is based on HTML and JavaScript. JQuery supports various web languages.
Dojo is comparatively strict to use. JQuery is easy to use.
Dojo requires higher network bandwidth. JQuery is capable of working on higher as well as lower network bandwidth.
Dojo is used for creating a more prominent website and application. JQuery is preferred generally for simple websites./td>

question: 17) What are the several Dijit layout widgets?
answer:
A list of several Dijit layout widgets:
ContentPane
LinkPane
Border Container
Tab Container
Split Container
Stack Container
Accordion Container

question: 18) Which conditions have to be fulfilled for a function of Dojo/ready module record a callback?
answer:
The Dojo/ ready module has a function that records a callback that runs once the three conditions have met:
DOM is ready
All outstanding or remaining modules of requested code have completed loading
Other registered functions with a higher priority have completed.
